column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  July 6 Brazil's state-run Petrobras must pay the government about 350 million reais ($112 million) more in royalties each quarter for oil produced in seven offshore fields under an arbitration ruling  the company said on Monday.

column4: Zoloft plaintiffs  Pfizer set to spar in second hearing on expert witnesses
column5: Pfizer Inc is seeking to strike a major blow to litigation over its antidepressant Zoloft by asking a federal judge  for a second time  to disqualify a key expert witness that plaintiffs say can show the drug causes birth defects.

column4: PVH's apparel deal with Trump ends as Macy's cuts ties with tycoon
column5: PVH Corp  said it would wind down the production of Donald Trump's menswear after exclusive retail partner Macy's Inc  decided to stop selling his products in protest against racist remarks made by the real estate tycoon.

column4: PVH's apparel deal with Trump ends as Macy's cuts ties with tycoon
column5: July 7 PVH Corp said it would wind down the production of Donald Trump's menswear after exclusive retail partner Macy's Inc decided to stop selling his products in protest against racist remarks made by the real estate tycoon.

column4: Fitch Affirms Realty Income's IDR at 'BBB+'; Rates $250MM Term Loan
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  July 07 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed the ratings of Realty  Income Corporation with the IDR at 'BBB+'. Fitch has also assigned a 'BBB+'  rating to the $250 million unsecured term loan due 2020.  KEY RATING DRIVERS The affirmation of Realty Income's IDR at 'BBB+' reflects the granularity of its  predominantly retail net lease portfolio  its disciplined acquisition strategy  and management track record. column4: MOVES- Goldman Sachs  RSA Insurance  Royal Bank of Canada
column5: July 7 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Tuesday. To inform us of other job changes  email moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column4: RBC names new head of wealth management and insurance
column5: TORONTO  July 7 Royal Bank of Canada  said on Tuesday that Doug Guzman  head of global investment banking  has been promoted to group head of wealth management and insurance business.

column4: Watchdog urges FDA to revoke approval of Genzyme surgical implant
column5: Consumer watchdog Public Citizen said it petitioned U.S. health regulators to withdraw approval of Sanofi SA's Seprafilm and order a recall  saying the surgical implant has been associated with side effects including death.

column4: Statoil to decide on Scottish floating wind farm in September
column5: OSLO Norway's oil and gas firm Statoil plans to take the final investment decision in September on building a floating wind farm off the coast of Scotland  set to be the first of its kind in the world  a spokesman for the company said on Tuesday.

column4: Statoil to decide on Scottish floating wind farm in September
column5: OSLO  July 7 Norway's oil and gas firm Statoil  plans to take the final investment decision in September on building a floating wind farm off the coast of Scotland  set to be the first of its kind in the world  a spokesman for the company said on Tuesday.

column5: * Says orders equipment from Nova Measuring Instruments Ltd  for T$501 million ($16.19 million)

column4: Tallgrass lifts force majeure on REX Wyoming compressor station
column5: July 6 Tallgrass Energy Partners LP on Monday lifted a force majeure on the Wamsutter echo springs compressor station of its Rockies Express (REX) natural gas pipeline.

column4: Robo-advisor Wealthfront lowers account minimum to $500
column5: NEW YORK  July 7 Wealthfront  one of the biggest of a new breed of investment management firms known as "robo-advisors " on Tuesday lowered the minimum investment customers must make to open an account  to $500 from $5 000.

column4: Toyota-Peugeot Czech car plant raises production by 38 pct
column5: PRAGUE  July 7 Toyota Motor Corp's and PSA Peugeot Citroen's car factory in the Czech Republic increased first-half production by 38 percent to 114 694 vehicles thanks to the launch of new models  the company which operates the joint venture said on Tuesday.

column4: Arrested ex-Toyota exec Hamp to be released from custody: Kyodo
column5: TOKYO Tokyo prosecutors plan to release former Toyota Motor Corp executive Julie Hamp from custody after she was arrested last month on suspicion of illegally importing the painkiller Oxycodone into Japan  Kyodo News reported on Tuesday.

column4: Arrested ex-Toyota exec Hamp to be released from custody - Kyodo
column5: TOKYO  July 7 Tokyo prosecutors plan to release former Toyota Motor Corp executive Julie Hamp from custody after she was arrested last month on suspicion of illegally importing the painkiller oxycodone into Japan  Kyodo News reported on Tuesday.

column4: Western Union restarts money transfer service in Greece
column5: Western Union Co said it restarted money transfer service in Greece  allowing customers in the country to receive funds from overseas.
